revised_title: Investigating Unidentified Sulphur Groupings in Protein Molecules
tldr: The authors investigated the existence of unidentified sulphur groupings in protein molecules, focusing on the denaturation of proteins. They discovered that some proteins contain sulphur in a form other than cystine, and discussed various experimental findings and methods for identifying these sulphur compounds. This research contributes to understanding the chemistry of proteins and their structure.
